ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] StackOverflowError
ygData.msgSnippet: My guess would be that some custom state added to the CrawlURI in Roger s configuration needs additional support to either be ignored during Kryo

X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo
From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>

My guess would be that some custom state added to the CrawlURI in 
Roger's configuration needs additional support to either be ignored 
during Kryo serialization, or otherwise specially-handled.

Check out the AutoKryo class, and references to that class via existing 
classes' autoregisterTo() methods, for examples. Look in your _out.log 
for syserr messages "UNREGISTERED FOR KRYO" as hints of classes that 
*might* need non-default handling. (IIRC, such messages aren't fatal, 
but it's still a good idea for anything going through this serialization 
to have been pre-registered, rather than follow the default/make-up path.)

There might be prior JIRA issues that resolved similar problems that are 
helpful for understanding the ways serialization may fail; this one came 
up in a quick search (though it's obviously not quite the same issue, 
may still be instructive if adopting your own classes for 
serialization): https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-1912

- Gordon

On 6/25/14, 3:43 AM, Kristinn Sigurðsson kristinn@... 
[archive-crawler] wrote:
> I can also report that I very recently did a large scale crawl testing H3.3 with Java 8 and did not see the issue you described, Roger.
